reviewText:
Extremely simple puzzle game (click clusters of matching adjacent colored coins to score points).

This is for very casual gamers which don't expect much from a game.

Simple and basic time waster for short spans of time where you don't feel like doing any real gaming.

70/100

reviewText: This game of Big Money doesn't look like a thinking mans game but it is. You have to get 3 or more of the same color close enough together to have all 3 touching so you can make them disappear but when you make those 3 disappear it makes the other colors surrounding come together so you can collect upon those colors to create great combos of as many colors or tokens as you muster up together.  It has different game modes to entertain those that want a challenge and for those that just like to get rid of things in their lives and see progress in little portions. It is a great game for those people that like to think their way through complicated situations of decision making. It is also a great game for casual gamers looking to burn a couple minutes and money while playing.

reviewText:
A pretty fun and simple game.

Coins spawn and build up the play field, requiring you to click on the same coins in bundles of three or more to eliminate them. The faster you click coins the more points you get, I find myself just click spamming like a mad man and got to level 9.
Once a row of coins reaches the top (much like Tetris) the game is over.

The music and gameplay is really fun, another game I would recommend if you're bored!

9/10

reviewText: On my quest to play all the games in my library I played Big Money. Its ok and I am sure at its time it was a nice little att the office" type game however since the genre has seen much more innovation like Bejewelled or one of my fav of the genre "Puzzle Quest" anyhow for its time i would say it would be fun as a little office escape as long as you were competing fort high scores amongst many."
